content.description: Stand start left of Initial Friction and climb straight up the friction slab using granite smears and a crimp. Topout once you have the sequence dialed. Avoiding all the holds on Initial Friction felt closer to V7.
content.protection: Two pads is ideal so you can stuff one in the hole and lay the other on top to keep the landing flat.
content.location: This line goes straight up the most blank section of the slab side of the Goodrich Boulder, directly over the small rock. (Purple on the topo)

content.description: Sit start far left on the arete. Traverse right to a tricky crux, dropping down on to a jug. Recover, and pull fun moves along good rails to top out at the highest point of the boulder.
content.protection: Pads and a spotter. The crux is safe, but the V0 finish can be a bit spicy due to the large boulder underneath the topout.
content.location: Camp 4 West, on the Goodrich Boulder. Just west of Cocaine Corner, and up the hill through a tree or two from the Pratt Boulder.

content.description: Start from the ground and slap up the side using a combination of toes / heels. Keep shuffling your hands along the sloppers at the top until you eventually join and finish on the rails of Tendons Give.
content.protection: Multiple pads to prevent a potentially bad fall on a slab
content.location: To the right of the Tendons Give finish.

content.description: Fun route, follows the crimps up the face then tops out on the slopers going to the crux which is the mantle, a fall here could be bad so have spotters and pads
content.location: To the right of “cocaine corner” starts on the two down pulling crimps

content.description: Start on the jug in the middle of Tendons Give and go straight up with athletic moves.
content.location: In the middle of the tendons give traverse.

content.description: Traverse right along the face of the Goodrich Boulder using large edges, jugs, and underclings before toping out. Top out is easy and the landing is very safe.
content.location: The Goodrich Boulder is located next to the Wine Boulder on the north west side.

content.description: This smoothly cleaved slab is exciting and aesthetic. Expect typical polished Yos slab work. Another cool weather problem. The right arete (Cocaine Corner) is off.

This technical arete/face is one of the all-time classics on the Camp 4 circuit. Slap, pinch, layaway, smear, highstep and edge your way up to an insecure crux involving a weight transfer or foot dyno just before the top. A very sequential cool weather problem that sees plenty of suitors, but few ascents considering the rating.
content.protection: There's a bad chopper block in the drop-zone that has claimed a few broken bones over the years. But, with sufficient pads (3-5) it's completely safe to bomb off the crux.
content.location: Directly adjacent to the old paved trail that runs through the boulders above camp, across from the Wine Boulder. Downclimb the low angle slab left of Initial Friction.
